text: Oh
hi guys I'm Laura Vitale on this episode
of Laura in the kitchen I'm going to
show you how to make what I like to call
a chicken pita sandwich this is a really
simple simple recipe but I thought I
would show it to you because I love this
kind of food because it's perfect for
lunch and I figured everyone's getting
ready to go back to school and whether
you're in middle school or high school
or a parent that's going back to work or
anybody that's on the go really these
kind of recipes I think are key to being
able to eat a good healthy lunch without
having to sacrifice you know without
having to spend hours and hours in the
kitchen or having to going and get some
fast food just because you don't have
time so the recipe is just using things
I have left over I mean when I made this
recipe it for the first time buta the
recipe these are the ingredients I use
which is some pita bread and these are
some whole-wheat pita pockets some
spring mix tomatoes this is some cooked
chicken that I've shredded I've got some
kalamata olives pitted and I've got some
sun-dried tomatoes basil garlic got some
red onion salt and pepper extra virgin
olive oil and balsamic vinegar now I
suggest if you are taking this to lunch
put the pita on the side that way it
doesn't get soggy it is such a good to
go a go-to recipe and I'm using my
leftover roast chicken I make roast
chicken at least once a week in our
house because I adore roast chicken but
I love leftovers I think personally I
think leftovers leftovers chicken is the
best part of having a roast chicken so
you can do a bunch of different things
with it so if you want to learn how to
make my roast chicken there's a recipe
on laurainthekitchen.com go check it out
so I'm going now and I'm cutting my
onion into little small pieces I'm going
to dice it really nice and fine I'm
probably not going to use the whole
onion and like I said this is a perfect
recipe to use whatever you've got left
over if you got some cucumbers if you
want to use totally different
ingredients than i'm using then by all
means go right ahead you can put in
shredded carrots some celery some bell
peppers you name it if you want to do
like a Mayo dressing you can do that but
just if you are taking it to lunch you
want to make sure that it's kept
refrigerated it's kept really cold but
by doing it this way I don't have to
worry about that because I'm going to
put olive oil and vinegar on it and it
will stay perfect so there you go chop
up some garlic nice and fine as well and
like I said if you are you know a child
or a teenager or whatnot try making
yourself a nice lunch the night before
and least you've got something to look
forward to that makes you happy
throughout the day just gonna chop this
up and then I'm gonna chop my basil as
well along with my olives and my
sun-dried tomatoes and I'll show you
what the mixture looks like once it's
all chopped last of my sun-dried
tomatoes and a season it was in salt and
pepper go light on the salt just because
you have the olives that are very very
salty now and I laugh because when I say
think these are things I have on hand I
really mean it because I mean I cook
mostly Italian so I always have olives I
always have sun-dried tomatoes in the
pantry I've got some marinated
artichokes things like that but this is
something I was really curious about and
I want all of you well I want you to
comment below what I want to know is I
know there's a lot of different people
that watch Lauren the kitchen from all
all over the world so what I'm curious
is from where you are in your country
what are your ingredients that you
always have leftover you know as an
Italian I always got some Tomatoes I've
always got basil I've got things like
that but what were your from what are
the staples in your kitchen that you
find yourself that you've got bits and
pieces left up I'm really curious
because I know I'm a foodie I like food
so I'm just drizzling a little bit more
olive oil and vinegar that looks good
give it a toss now if I was taking this
to work tomorrow
or school this is the point where I
would put this and its own little

a bit of lettuce and tomato on the side
and then assemble it at lunchtime I'm
not going to school tomorrow and I

going to cut my pita at my pita pocket
in half let's put it open but be gentle
I'm going to put in a couple slices of

just a tiny tad put some lettuce and
some of your chicken salad mixture what

hmmm
so what so yummy I love this combination
